Topic.Title: Nexus tablet sales estimates prove that the Nexus 10 may not be a hit.....AT ALL! (we could've told you)

Message.Msg: wow, ibey totally losing it = Jen must have gone totally rabid because of the failure of the whole tegra program. The success/non success of the Nexus 7 vs Nexus 10 was totally due to pricing. Yet Jen has gone rabid thinking it has anything to do with the processor. Just watch, if they keep the prices the same, Nexus 7 refresh with Snapdragon will be a huge success while the Nexus 10 refresh, regardless of which processor it comes with, will do just as well as the first Nexus 10. And of course that will drive Jen even more rabid..... and 'ibey more over the wall'....... There ain't no high end app processor market that Jen has been targeting for the last 5 years. Time to kick out this CEO and bring in another one with more business sense.
The NVDA shorts play hard ball, that's for sure. I'm not feeling a run at 13 today... Still rabge-bound for the time being...
Welcome to options manipulation day.

Topic.Title: Nexus tablet sales estimates prove that the Nexus 10 may not be a hit.....AT ALL! (we could've told you)

Message.Msg: Which comes first, the high end apps, or the high end processors needed for the apps? I would say the processors, so even though there is no current high end app market, there probably will be in some time. Were there applications that needed GPUs prior to 1999?

Topic.Title: Nexus tablet sales estimates prove that the Nexus 10 may not be a hit.....AT ALL! (we could've told you)

Message.Msg: you are not 'getting it' no market is due to the particular PLAYERS in the market that nvda targeted, not due to processors/apps. Advise: if you can't understand that, you are better off with your money under your mattress.

Yes, it looks like there isn't going to be enough volume to get us to make that run. I'm really quite surprised that we revisited almost exactly last week's low during Jen's presentation. I think that was 12.35 or so. On the flip side, there are not a large number of the 12 1/2s outstanding, so I wouldn't think that would be an easy target for them to manipulate us to. However, given the massacre of many of the semis the last few days, we will need some "news" or just a major increase in the volume in order to get any kind of reversal. IF the volume does arrive, I'd expect it to come later in the morning, and, of course, in The Final Hour. This is the last expiration that has any serious OI until we get to May and June monthly OpEx, and we'll have had earnings and other possible catalysts before we get to the May OpEx. I DO expect us to finish today, higher. I'd like to see us at least get to 12.75 or so. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time.
